title: Anahí
text:
{{short description|Mexican singer-songwriter, stylist and actress}}
{{About|a Mexican actress}}
{{BLP sources|date=October 2016}}
{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2021}}
{{family name hatnote|Puente|Portilla|lang=Spanish}}

| name               = Anahí
| image              = Anahí Puente 2009.jpg
| caption            = Anahí in 2009.
| birth_name         = Anahí Giovanna Puente Portilla

'''Anahí Giovanna Puente Portilla de Velasco''' (born 14 May 1983), known [[Mononymous person|mononymously]] as '''Anahí''', is a Mexican actress and singer. In 1986, she started her acting career when she was cast on ''[[Chiquilladas]]''. After working on many successful [[telenovela]]s produced by [[Televisa]], including ''[[Alondra (TV series)|Alondra]]'' (1995), ''[[Vivo Por Elena|Vivo por Elena]]'' (1998), ''[[El diario de Daniela|El Diario de Daniela]]'' (1998) and ''[[Mujeres engañadas|Mujeres Engañadas]]'' (1999), her first [[leading role]] was in [[Pedro Damián]]'s production, ''[[Primer amor, a mil por hora|Primer Amor... A Mil por Hora]]'' (2000). In 2003, she joined the cast in ''[[Clase 406]]''. Anahí reached international success in 2004 after starring in ''[[Rebelde]]'' and being part of the twice-nominated for a [[Latin Grammy Awards|Latin Grammy Award]] group [[RBD]], who sold over 15 million records worldwide.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=RBD: So Hot, So Fast |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/58334/rbd-so-hot-so-fast |magazine=Billboard |date=May 23, 2006 |access-date=September 19, 2018}}</ref> In 2011, she starred in ''[[Dos hogares|Dos Hogares]]'', her last telenovela to date.

In 1993, at the age of 10, Anahí released her debut [[Anahí (album)|self-titled studio album]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.last.fm/music/Anah%C3%AD/Anah%C3%AD|title=Anahí — Anahí|website=Last.fm|language=en|access-date=2019-10-24}}</ref> In 1996, she released her second album, ''[[¿Hoy Es Mañana?]]'', which featured the [[Single (music)|single]]s "Corazón de Bombón", "Por Volverte a Ver" and "Descontrolándote". She went on to record two additional albums titled ''[[Anclado En Mi Corazón|Anclado en Mi Corazón]]'' (1997) and ''[[Baby Blue (album)|Baby Blue]]'' (2000). In 2009, Anahí released her fifth [[album]], ''[[Mi Delirio]]'', which sold 500,000 copies worldwide.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvnotas.com.mx/famosos/52-anahi-/|title=Anahí|work=TVNotas|language=es|access-date=2012-10-19|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170425002448/http://www.tvnotas.com.mx/famosos/52-anahi-/|archive-date=2017-04-25|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album debuted at number two on [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']]{{'}}s [[Latin Pop Albums]] chart and number four on ''Billboard''{{'}}s [[Top Latin Albums]] chart,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/anahi/chart-history/latin-pop-albums |title=Anahi Chart History | Billboard |website=www.billboard.com |access-date=13 January 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180817135033/https://www.billboard.com/music/anahi/chart-history/latin-pop-albums |archive-date=17 August 2018 |url-status=dead}}</ref> and was [[Music recording certification|certified]] Gold in Brazil.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://princesadelpoplatino.blogspot.com/2012/05/anahi-disco-de-oro-en-brasil.html|title=Anahi disco de oro en Brasil}}</ref> [[Mi Delirio World Tour]] was her first worldwide tour. According to ''Billboard'', Mi Delirio World Tour was the seventh most profitable tour of 2010.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/photos/live/958515/hot-tours-black-eyed-peas-muse-lady-gaga|title = Hot Tours: Black Eyed Peas, Muse, Lady Gaga|magazine = [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date = 22 April 2010}}</ref>

Anahí's sixth studio album, ''[[Inesperado]]'' (2016), was preceded by the singles "[[Rumba (Anahí song)|Rumba]]", "Eres" and "Amnesia". "Rumba", a collaboration with [[reggaeton]] singer [[Wisin]], peaked at number one on ''Billboard''{{'}}s Tropical Songs chart.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/anahi/chart-history/tropical-songs |title=Anahi Chart History | Billboard |website=www.billboard.com |access-date=13 January 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180817145123/https://www.billboard.com/music/anahi/chart-history/tropical-songs |archive-date=17 August 2018 |url-status=dead}}</ref> The album debuted on ''Billboard''{{'}}s Latin Pop Albums and Top Latin Albums charts,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/anahi/chart-history/latin-albums |title=Anahi Chart History | Billboard |website=www.billboard.com |access-date=13 January 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190826120910/https://www.billboard.com/music/anahi/chart-history/latin-albums |archive-date=26 August 2019 |url-status=dead}}</ref> while it was number one on ''Billboard'' Brazil, with her being the first Mexican artist to achieve that.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.latinpopbrasil.com.br/noticias/billboard-confirma-sucesso-de-anahi-no-brasil/|title=Anahi lidera lista de mais vendidos da Billboard|date=13 July 2016}}</ref> She has sold over five million albums worldwide in her career as a solo artist,<ref>[https://archive.today/20130111210249/http://www.sintesis.mx/puebla/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=21557 <!-- |access-date=July 3, 2012 --> ]</ref> being the best-selling RBD member in the United States.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://paratodos.com/pt/anahi-princesa-del-pop/|title = Anahí- Princesa del Pop : Para Todos magazine}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://diversao.r7.com/tv-e-entretenimento/fotos/de-chaves-a-thalia-saiba-por-onde-andam-os-idolos-da-tv-mexicana-09062017#!/foto/9|title = De Chaves a Thalía, saiba por onde andam os ídolos da TV mexicana|date = 3 September 2014}}</ref> Anahí sings in various languages apart from [[Spanish language|Spanish]], including [[English language|English]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] and [[Italian language|Italian]].

==Early life==
Anahí Giovanna Puente was born on 14 May 1983, in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]], to Spanish father Enrique Puente, and Mexican mother Tysha Portilla.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.excelsior.com.mx/2011/06/27/funcion/747910|title=Crece la niña Anahí|work=Excélsior|date=27 June 2011|language=es}}</ref> She has an older sister, television personality Marichelo Puente<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://elintranews.com/celebrities/2020/12/09/me-tuvieron-que-operar-marichelo-puente-hermana-de-anahi-comparte-los-detalles-de-su-estado-de-salud/|title="Me tuvieron que operar": Marichelo Puente, hermana de Anahí, comparte los detalles de su estado de salud|work=El Intranews|date=2020-12-09|language=es}}</ref> (born 1978), and an older half-sister, Diana Puente, from her father's previous marriage.{{citation needed|date=January 2021}}

==Acting career==
[[File:Anahí.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Anahí at a press conference in 2006]]

Anahí began her career on a Mexican television program called ''[[Chiquilladas]]'' When she was two years old. She then starred in numerous films, including ''Nacidos para Morir'' and ''Había Una Vez Una Estrella'', with the latter earning her an [[Ariel Award]] for Best Child Actress in 1989.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www2.esmas.com/entretenimiento/biografias/009387/anahi/|title=Anahí|work=Espectáculos|language=es|access-date=2012-07-03|archive-date=2012-06-27|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120627054659/http://www2.esmas.com/entretenimiento/biografias/009387/anahi|url-status=dead}}</ref> She then went on to star in several telenovelas, including ''Mujer, Casos de la Vida Real'', ''Hora Marcada'', ''Vivo por Elena'', ''La Telaraña'' and ''[[El diario de Daniela]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www2.esmas.com/entretenimiento/biografias/009387/anahi/|title=Anahí|work=Espectáculos|language=es|access-date=2012-07-03|archive-date=2012-06-27|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120627054659/http://www2.esmas.com/entretenimiento/biografias/009387/anahi|url-status=dead}}</ref>

In 2001, Anahí was cast as the fourteen-year-old Jovanna Luna in ''Primer Amor'', alongside [[Kuno Becker]], [[Ana Layevska]], and [[Mauricio Islas]]. The teen-oriented soap opera was one of the highest-rated in its time-slot during its run.

In 2002, she was cast as Jessica in ''[[Clase 406]]'' where she worked alongside [[Alfonso Herrera]], [[Dulce María]], and [[Christian Chávez]], who later became her bandmates in RBD.<ref>{{Citation|title=Clase 406|date=27 January 2003|url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0327274/|access-date=2019-10-24}}</ref>

She starred in ''[[Rebelde (Mexican TV series)|Rebelde]]'' in 2004, a Mexican remake of the hit [[Argentina|Argentine]] telenovela, ''[[Rebelde Way]]''. Before ''Rebelde'', Anahí had coincidentally starred in ''Ángeles Sin Paraíso'' with [[Felipe Colombo]], star of the original ''Rebelde Way''. On ''Rebelde'', Anahí portrayed [[List of Rebelde characters|Mia Colucci]], a popular girl from a wealthy family. ''Rebelde'' was an international hit and had over 440 episodes, airing from 2004 to 2006.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wikihow.com/Be-Like-Mia-Colucci-from-Rebelde|title=How to Be Like Mia Colucci from Rebelde|work=wikiHow|access-date=2012-07-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120614184913/http://www.wikihow.com/Be-Like-Mia-Colucci-from-Rebelde|archive-date=2012-06-14|url-status=dead}}</ref>

Following the success of ''Rebelde'', in 2007, [[Televisa]] released ''[[RBD: La familia]]'', which starred the members of RBD. The sitcom was based on the fictional lives of the members of RBD. The characters of the sitcom were not based on the band's characters in ''Rebelde'', but were instead intended to be similar to the actors' real personalities. ''RBD: La Familia'' was the first Mexican show shot entirely in [[high-definition television|HDTV]]. The show ran from 14 March 2007, to 13 June 2007, lasting 13 episodes.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1005814/epcast|title="RBD: La familia" (2007) - Episodes cast|work=IMDb}}</ref>

In February 2011, four years after her last appearance in a TV series, Anahí was chosen to play the lead role in ''[[Dos hogares|Dos Hogares]]'', a telenovela written and produced by [[Emilio Larrosa]].<ref>{{Citation|title=Double Life|date=27 June 2011|url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1909962/|access-date=2019-10-24}}</ref> After prolonged negotiations, Anahí accepted the role. Filming began on 25 April 2011, and ended on 14 January 2012. The TV series premiered on 27 June 2011, and aired its final episode on 20 January 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tvynovelas.com/video/392818/anahi-ltimas-escenas-dos-hogares |title= Anahí... Últimas escenas de "Dos hogares"|date=19 January 2012|website=www.tvynovelas.com |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323191205/http://www.tvynovelas.com/video/392818/anahi-ltimas-escenas-dos-hogares |archive-date=23 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/anahi-inicia-grabaciones-de-dos-hogares|title=Anahí inicia grabaciones de Dos hogares|work=PeopleenEspanol.com|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.impre.com/la-gente-dice/viewArticle.action?articleId=281474978927398|title=impre.com}}</ref>

==Music career==
[[File:Anahí Puente 4, 2009.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Anahí performing in Tijuana, México (2009)]]
In 1993, at the age of 10, she released her debut album, ''[[Anahí (album)|Anahí]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.last.fm/music/Anah%C3%AD/Anah%C3%AD|title=Anahí — Anahí|website=Last.fm|language=en|access-date=2019-10-24}}</ref> She later released a second album, ''[[¿Hoy Es Mañana?]]'', which featured the singles "Corazón de Bombón", "Por Volverte a Ver", and "Descontrolándote". She went on to record two additional albums titled ''[[Anclado En Mi Corazón]]'' and ''[[Baby Blue (album)|Baby Blue]].''

The success of ''[[Rebelde (Mexican telenovela)|Rebelde]]'' launched [[RBD]]. RBD released nine studio albums, including records in [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] and [[English language|English]]. They have sold over 20 million albums worldwide, 17 million digital downloads, and have toured across [[South America]], [[North America]], [[Central America]] and [[Europe]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emimusic.es/artistas/noticias/1138/1318|title=emimusic.es|language=es|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312104712/http://www.emimusic.es/artistas/noticias/1138/1318|archive-date=2012-03-12}}</ref>
 
In 2006, following the success of RBD, Anahí re-released her solo album, ''Baby Blue'', under the name ''[[Una Rebelde en Solitario]]''. The following year, a compilation album was released titled, ''Antes de Ser Rebelde''.

On 15 August 2008, RBD released a statement, stating that they had decided to split up. They went on one final tour, [[Gira del Adiós World Tour]], which ended in late 2008. In November 2008, Anahi and Dulce María collaborated with [[Tiziano Ferro]] on a song called "[[Il regalo più grande|El Regalo Más Grande]]".

In April 2009, Anahí launched an official website and Twitter page announcing her first solo album since RBD's split.<ref>[http://www.telaveo.com/anahi-graba-su-nuevo-disco/2009/04/ Anahi recorded his new album.] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090514002349/http://www.telaveo.com/anahi-graba-su-nuevo-disco/2009/04/ |date=14 May 2009 }}</ref> She debuted her first solo single since RBD, "[[Mi Delirio (song)|Mi Delirio]]", at the [[2009 Premios Juventud]] in [[Miami]], [[Florida]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://musica.univision.com/premios-juventud/historia/slideshow/2011-03-24/fotos-premios-juventud-2009|title=Música|work=univision.com|language=es}}</ref> It was released for digital download on 18 August 2009.<ref>[https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/mi-delirio-single/id327304825 Mi Delirio - Single - iTunes]</ref> ''[[Mi Delirio]]'' was released on 24 November 2009. The album has been certified Gold in [[Brazil]], Anahí becoming the second Mexican artist — after [[Thalía]] — who was certified Gold in that country.<ref>[http://abpd.org.br/certificados_interna.asp?sArtista=Anah%ED Mi Delirio is gold in Brazil.]</ref>

According to ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'', [[Mi Delirio World Tour]] was the seventh most profitable tour in 2010. She performed in 10 concerts, attended by over 35,000 people.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/photos/live/958515/hot-tours-black-eyed-peas-muse-lady-gaga|title=Hot Tours: Black Eyed Peas, Muse, Lady Gaga|magazine=Billboard|date=22 April 2010}}</ref>

[[File:Anahí Puente 2, 2010.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Anahí at her [[Mi Delirio World Tour]] at [[São Paulo]], [[Brazil]] (2010)]]
Following the success of ''Mi Delirio'', on 23 November 2010, Anahí released [[Mi Delirio|''Mi Delirio'' – deluxe edition]]. The album includes all the songs released with the first album, plus four bonus songs: "[[Alérgico]]", "Pobre Tu Alma", "Ni Una Palabra" and "Aleph". The first two were released as singles. The album also contains a letter from Brazilian author [[Paulo Coelho]] to Anahí, a photo gallery, and a written message from Anahí to her fans.<ref>[https://itunes.apple.com/mx/album/mi-delirio-edicion-deluxe/id401358329 Mi Delirio (Edición Deluxe) - Album] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015001342/https://itunes.apple.com/mx/album/mi-delirio-edicion-deluxe/id401358329 |date=October 15, 2013 }}</ref> The album contains a song inspired by Coelho's book [[Aleph]], which follows the third single "Alérgico". There are three known versions of the song: the album version with Anahí only; the Portuguese version featuring Brazilian singer Renee Fernandes, included in the ''Mi Delirio'' – deluxe edition (Brazilian edition bonus track); and a duet version featuring [[Noel Schajris]], included in the ''Mi Delirio'' – deluxe edition (Colombian edition bonus track). (In the US, this version is instead being on a special edition, ''Alérgico (Fan edition) – EP''.)<ref>[https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/alergico-fan-edition-ep/id402917456 Alérgico (Fan Edition) - EP by Anahí]</ref>

[[File:Anahí Puente 2, 2011.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Anahí at her [[Mi Delirio World Tour]] at [[Rio de Janeiro (city)|Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brazil]] (2011)]]
In 2010, Anahí presented the [[Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards|Kids Choice Awards Mexico]] and was nominated in three categories, winning for Favorite Artist and Favorite Look. She performed as well, introducing her single, "Alérgico".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.quien.com/espectaculos/2010/09/04/anahi-brillo-en-los-kids-kids-choice-awards|title=Anahí brilló en los Kids Choice Awards|date=4 September 2010|work=quien.com|language=es}}</ref> The album debuted at number 14 in Mexico, spending seven consecutive weeks in the top 100. "Alérgico" became the second most played song in Mexico for 11 weeks, and was number one on [[iTunes]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.quien.com/espectaculos/2010/10/20/alergico-de-anahi-es-numero-uno-en-ventas|title='Alérgico´ de Anahí es número uno en ventas|date=20 October 2010|work=quien.com|language=es}}</ref>

In 2011, Anahí and Christian Chávez worked together for the first time since the dissolution of RBD. They recorded a song, "Libertad", which was released on iTunes on 12 April 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/christian-chavez-y-anahi-estrenan-libertad|title=Christian Chávez y Anahí estrenan "Libertad"|work=PeopleenEspanol.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/br/album/libertad-ep/id434711892|title=Libertad - EP|work=iTunes|date=26 April 2011|language=es}}</ref> The song was included on Christian Chávez's album. In May 2011, Anahí and the [[Latin pop]] stars [[Jay de la Cueva|Bryan Amadeus]] and [[Miranda!|Ale Sergi]] were invited by [[MTV (Latin America)|MTV Latin America]] to perform the opening theme for the TV series ''Popland!''. The song, entitled "Click", was released on iTunes on 13 September 2011.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.informador.com.mx/entretenimiento/2011/314110/6/anahi-bryan-amadeus-y-ale-sergi-hacen-click.htm|title=Anahí, Bryan Amadeus y Ale Sergi hacen ''Click''|newspaper=EL INFORMADOR|access-date=2016-10-13}}</ref> On 5 July 2011, Anahí released a new single, "Dividida", which is also the opening theme of the TV series she starred in, ''Dos Hogares''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/anahi-dividida|title=Anahí: "Dividida"|work=PeopleenEspanol.com}}</ref> She also recorded the ending theme with [[Carlos Ponce]], "Rendirme En Tu Amor", which was released on J
24 July 2011. In December 2011, Anahí was invited by prodigious Mexican singer [[Juan Gabriel]] to be featured on a song with him on his album of duets, entitled "Con Tu Amor".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://musica.univision.com/noticias/article/2011-12-19/anahi-juan-gabriel-twitter-dueto-foto|title=Música|work=univision.com|language=es}}</ref>

Anahí released a song called "Absurda" in late 2012, and its lyric video was released on YouTube on 30 January.<ref>{{cite web|title=Anahí estrena en Twitter el tema "Absurda"; ¡escúchalo aquí! |url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/anahi-estrena-en-twitter-el-tema-absurda-escuchalo-aqui |work=[[People en Español]]|access-date=11 February 2013|language=es}}</ref> On 4 February 2013, the single was released for digital download.<ref>{{cite web|title=Futura primera dama Anahi ya a la venta |url=http://www.diariobasta.com/nota.php?id_nota=13117&contador_modulo=1&modulo=noticias_al_momento |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130308054746/http://www.diariobasta.com/nota.php?id_nota=13117&contador_modulo=1&modulo=noticias_al_momento |url-status=dead |archive-date=8 March 2013 |work=Diario Basta |access-date=11 February 2013 |language=es }}</ref> A new album was announced with a 2013 release date, but was later cancelled.

Anahí released a song, "Están Ahí", without any previous promotion, on 25 May 2015. The song's lyrics pay homage to her fans. A month later, she announced the return of her musical career and released a comeback single "[[Rumba (Anahí song)|Rumba]]" featuring Puerto Rican rapper [[Wisin]], and the album ''Inesperado'' was released in 2016.

Anahí and her RBD bandmates reunited for a live concert, held on December 26, 2020.

==First Lady of Chiapas==
{{Infobox officeholder
| honorific_prefix    = 
| name                = 
| honorific_suffix    =

| image_size          = 
| image_upright       = 
| caption             =

| term_end1           = 7 December 2018
| governor1           = [[Manuel Velasco Coello]]
| predecessor1        = Isabel Aguilera
| successor1          = [[Rosalinda López Hernández]]

On 25 April 2015, Anahí married [[Manuel Velasco Coello]], the [[Governor of Chiapas]], elected in December 2012. While her marriage to the sitting governor would normally make her the head of the Chiapas chapter of the [[National System for Integral Family Development]], the position had already been granted to Leticia Coello, the mother of the then-unmarried Governor, in 2012.

She was widely criticized on social media for wearing a dress costing the state 120,000 [[Mexican peso]]s ([[United States dollar|US$]]{{To USD|120000|MEX|year=2015|round=yes}}, {{Inflation|US|7572|2015|fmt=eq}}) during the 2015 celebrations of the [[Cry of Dolores]] in Chiapas.<ref>{{cite web|title=Anahí usó vestido valorado en 120 mil pesos durante ceremonia del Grito en Chiapas; la critican en redes|date=20 September 2015|url=http://www.sinembargo.mx/20-09-2015/1492523|publisher=SinEmbargo|access-date=21 January 2016}}</ref> Many of the criticisms focused on the fact that Chiapas is the [[List of Mexican states by poverty rate|poorest State in the Union]].

==Personal life==
During the filming of ''Primer Amor'', Anahí battled a serious [[eating disorder]], [[Anorexia nervosa|anorexia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://archivo.univision.com/content/content.jhtml?cid=425276 |title=Yo! 105.1 |language=es |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120908044952/http://archivo.univision.com/content/content.jhtml?cid=425276 |archive-date=2012-09-08 }}</ref> She weighed approximately 75 pounds (34 kg) at her lowest weight. She spent time in five different treatment centers, and visited doctors and psychologists across the country. One day after returning from a family vacation, she began to feel faint, and was rushed to a hospital, where her heart stopped for eight seconds. She has since recovered and become a vocal spokesperson against eating disorders in Mexico. In 2008, with the support of Televisa, Anahí launched a campaign against anorexia and [[bulimia nervosa|bulimia]].<ref>[http://www.fundaciontelevisa.org/salud/anahi-contra-la-bulimia-y-anorexia.html Anahi - "Si Yo Puedo, Tú También" - Anahí Against Anorexia and Bulimia.] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090428054601/http://www.fundaciontelevisa.org/salud/anahi-contra-la-bulimia-y-anorexia.html |date=April 28, 2009 }}</ref>

In 2006, the tax administration of Mexico froze four of Anahí's bank accounts as a preventive measure because she was under investigation for [[Tax evasion|tax fraud]]. In 2008, after taking the issue to court, Anahí was granted her accounts back, two with [[Grupo Financiero Banamex|Banamex]] and two at [[Scotiabank]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/anahi-gana-juicio-en-su-contra-por-impuestos|title=Anahí gana juicio en su contra por impuestos|work=PeopleenEspanol.com|language=es}}</ref>
[[File:Anahí 2008-2.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Anahi in 2008.]]
In 2007, a [[Barbie]] doll version of Anahí, Dulce Maria, and Maite Perroni were released, based on their characters in ''Rebelde''. ''[[People en Español]]'' named her one of their "50 Most Beautiful" in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/los-50-mas-bellos-de-people-en-espanol|title=Los 50 más bellos de PEOPLE EN ESPAÑOL|work=PeopleenEspanol.com}}</ref>

On 11 March 2011, doctors discovered that Anahí's brain was being deprived of a large percentage of oxygen due to a [[Nasal septum deviation|deviated septum]].  It was determined that this was the main cause of several ailments that had plagued Anahí, including a [[Myocardial infarction|heart attack]]. She underwent a successful operation.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tvnotas.com.mx/2011/03/12/C-8318-anahi-es-operada-de-emergencia.php |title= Anahí es operada de emergencia|publisher=TVNotas.com.mx|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/operan-anahi-de-la-nariz |title= Operan a Anahí de la nariz|language=es|publisher=peopleenespanol.com}}</ref>

On 23 March 2011, Anahí became the spokeswoman for [[Snickers]] in Latin America.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/anahi-se-transforma-en-carlos-para-comercial-de-chocolate |title= Anahí se transforma en "Carlos" para comercial de chocolate |language=es|publisher=peopleenespanol.com}}</ref> The advertising campaign that was launched sparked controversy, with [[National Council to Prevent Discrimination]] and the National Institute of Women deeming the commercial [[Sexism|sexist]] and filing complaints. Anahí defended the campaign, saying that the commercial wasn't intended to offend anyone. Effem Mexico, the company behind Snickers, disagreed with the sexism complaints. However, before the advertisement aired, they conducted a survey among women, asking their opinions on the content. According to Effem, the majority of the women surveyed did not feel the advertisement was discriminatory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/comercial-de-anahi-sexista |title=Comercial de Anahí: ¿Sexista?|language=es |publisher=peopleenespanol.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.vanguardia.com.mx/noessexistacampanadesnickersanahi-1104149.html |title= No es sexista campaña de Snickers: Anahí|publisher=vanguardia.com.mx|language=es}}</ref>
[[File:Anahí Argentina Luna Park.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Anahí performing on the [[Mi Delirio World Tour]] (2010).]]
On 18 September 2011, [[National Geographic (U.S. TV channel)|National Geographic]] aired the original production of "Obsession: Bodies That Scream", filmed in Latin America, which featured the testimonies of people who suffer from [[body dysmorphic disorder|body dysmorphia]] and eating disorders. Anahí spoke about the five-year period in which she suffered from anorexia, and her recovery.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/espectaculos/107204.html|title=Anahí platica en la tv su infierno con la anorexia|date=10 August 2015|work=El Universal|language=es}}</ref>  On 12 October 2011, Anahí joined the [[The Non-Violence Project|Non-Violence Project]]'s campaign, "Imagine One Billion Faces For Peace", as a Global Ambassador. The campaign's ambassadors include public figures such as [[Paul McCartney]], [[Yoko Ono]], and [[Ringo Starr]]. The campaign aims to honor the legacy of the late [[John Lennon]] by calling for peace and non-violence worldwide.

During the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in [[London]], Anahí, alongside other Global Ambassadors, performed in an event for The Non-Violence Project presented by Yoko Ono.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/article/confirmado-anahi-cantara-en-los-juegos-olimpicos-2012|title=Confirmado: Anahí cantará en los Juegos Olímpicos 2012|work=PeopleenEspanol.com|language=es}}</ref> ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'' named her as one of the [[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim Hot 100]] of 2012, calling her a "Mexican beauty" who represents "a true triple threat: she sings, she acts, and writes hilarious tweets".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maxim.com/slideshow/hot-100/43451?slide=2 |title=Maxim Hot 100 2012 |publisher=Maxim |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120628073359/http://www.maxim.com/slideshow/hot-100/43451?slide=2 |archive-date=2012-06-28 }}</ref>

On 16 July 2013, a nail polish line by Anahí titled ''"BE by Anahí"'' was released.<ref>{{cite web|title=Anahí lanza línea de barnices|url=http://www.quien.com/espectaculos/2013/07/17/anahi-lanza-linea-de-barnices|work=Quien|access-date=12 August 2013|language=es|date=17 July 2013}}</ref> The line is a collection of 25 different colors, with names relating to her music like "rebelde", "delirio", "absurda", "click", "hipnótico" and "Sálvame".<ref>{{cite web|title=Anahí lanza su propia línea de esmaltes para uñas|url=http://la.eonline.com/mexico/2013/anahilanza-su-propia-linea-de-esmaltes-para-un-as/|work=E!|access-date=12 August 2013|language=es|date=18 July 2013}}</ref>

In April 2012, Anahí began dating the governor of [[Chiapas]], [[Manuel Velasco Coello]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entretenimiento.univision.com/chismes/romances/article/2012-08-22/anahi-y-manuel-velasco-presumieron-su-amor-en-nueva-york|title=Entretenimiento|work=univision.com|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://novelasyseries.univision.com/chismes/article/2012-08-23/anahi-y-manuel-velasco-ya-no-ocultan-su-amor|title=Novelas - Capitulos, Sinopsis, Temporadas y Resumenes del Novelas - Uvideos|work=Uvideos|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://mx.hola.com/famosos/201208222111/anahi-manuel-velasco-beso-hola/|title=En ¡HOLA!: Anahí y Manuel Velasco, el más romántico beso de película|work=HOLA|date=22 August 2012|language=es}}</ref> They became engaged in October 2014<ref>{{cite web|title=Anahí recibe anillo de compromiso|url=http://lahoradelanovela.com/2014/10/rebelde-telenovela-aniversario/|work=La Hora De La Novela|access-date=4 October 2014|language=es|date=4 October 2014}}</ref> and married on 25 April 2015, in a private religious ceremony held in [[San Cristóbal de las Casas]]. They have two sons: Manuel, born on 17 January 2017 and Emiliano, born on 2 February 2020.
